WAIL-TD -> Agents using langgraph

WAIL-TD is the abbreviation for what-am-I-learning-this-week, and I'm currently learning about AI agents and trying to build them using langgraph.

Why Langgraph?

Now you might ask, why langgraph? Because that provides to be useful in building production-grade agents and tooling.

Why do I care about production-grade applications? Well, I work on agents at work too! So now you get me.

Week 1: Introduction to Single Agent Systems

Started with building a single agent system using langgraph.

What is an Agent?

An agent is something like an assistant which does the job/task for you. An agent has access to a set of tools that it can make use of to interact with the external world and gather information outside its knowledge base. We make use of prompts to tell the agent what to do and how to do.

Let's understand this with the help of an example

What is a Knowledge Base?

Now, what's a knowledge base? In my simple words:

It's a collection of documents that has been fed to the assistant (known as training the LLM) so that it has adequate knowledge to answer user questions.
